remarks: Binary relation expressing ` B ` covers ` A ` , which means that ` B ` is larger than ` A ` and there is nothing in between.  Definition 3.2.18 of [PtakPulmannova] p. 68.  ( ~ cvbr analog.)  (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2011.)
statement:
cvrfval.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
cvrfval.s $e |- .< = ( lt ` K ) $.
cvrfval.c $e |- C = ( <o ` K ) $.
cvrval $p |- ( ( K e. A /\ X e. B /\ Y e. B ) -> ( X C Y <-> ( X .< Y /\ -. E. z e. B ( X .< z /\ z .< Y ) ) ) ) $.
$d B z $.
$d K z $.
$d X z $.
$d Y z $.
